TopicTitle: Need a re-entry heat testing profile

Articles.Content:
I want to verify the positioning of some radial mount equipment won't be burned up during re-entry (specifically, a direct re-entry from Duna). As such, I need to figure out the best Kerbin (or Eve) orbit that will have prolong entry that will exposed most of the parts.

What are the best PE and AP values for such?

I suspect that the equipment would be more likely to blow up due to skin temperature than core temperature, so it's probably not the time you spend in re-entry that will matter as much as your heat flux at peak.  That said, a good Duna transfer orbit is only 130 m/s past Kerbin escape velocity, so it should not be much different than dropping from Minmus altitude or so. 

As far as periapsis, I'd just test based on how you intend to enter from Duna.  The two major options there are going strait to landing the first time you enter atmosphere, or making a braking pass or two before the landing (which will likely help if you have heat problems).  For the former, 30km is a typical rule of thumb.  For the latter, 45km might be in the right range, though it depends on your ship's arodymanic properties.  Again, to capture around Kerbin you'll only need to bleed off ~130m/s in the first pass, and after that you can aerobrake down at your leisure if need be.
